summary: This Urgent Matter Report from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announces the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell on July 2, 2020, in Bradford, New Hampshire. It details the charges against her for facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls between 1994 and 1997 and for committing perjury in a 2016 civil deposition. The report also notes her evasion of authorities since Epstein's 2019 arrest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested on multiple counts for facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls between approximately 1994 and 1997. Also charged with perjury for false statements made in a 2016 civil deposition.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier whose sexual abuse of minor girls was facilitated by Ghislaine Maxwell, as detailed in the charges against her.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Listed as the District Point of Contact (POC) for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in this report.

connections.description: Maxwell was Epstein's former girlfriend, close confidant, and associate who was paid to manage his properties and is charged with conspiring to entice and transport minors for illegal sex acts with him.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: FBI-NY and USAO-SDNY arrested Ghislaine Maxwell at approximately 8:30am in Bradford, New Hampshire, on multiple charges related to facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minors.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested in July 2019. Maxwell began intentionally evading detection following this event.

events.title: Maxwell Purchases New Hampshire Property
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell purchased a residence in Bradford, New Hampshire, through an LLC, which is where she was later arrested.

events.title: Maxwell's Perjurious Deposition
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell provided false and perjurious statements under oath in a civil deposition regarding her role in facilitating Epstein's abuse of minor victims.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Facilitation
events.description: The period during which Maxwell is alleged to have enticed and groomed multiple minor girls to engage in sex acts with Jeffrey Epstein in various locations.

events.title: Start of USAO-SDNY Investigation
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York began investigating Jeffrey Epstein and his associates for abusing dozens of minor victims.

locations: United States District Court for the District of New Hampshire
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, in Bradford, New Hampshire, after evading authorities since Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
Maxwell is charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity, and perjury related to her role in facilitating Epstein's abuse of minors between 1994 and 1997.
The charges allege Maxwell befriended minor victims, groomed them, normalized sexual abuse, and was present during sex acts with Epstein.
Maxwell committed perjury during a 2016 civil deposition by providing false statements about her role in facilitating the abuse.
Maxwell purchased the New Hampshire property where she was arrested through an LLC in December 2019.
